title: What Does TTYT Mean? Definition in Texts, Snapchat, Instagram & More

steps.title: Say goodbye if the other person has something to do.
steps.content: Say goodbye if the other person has something to do. When someone uses TTYT to tell you they have to go, the polite thing to do is simply say â€œGoodbye.â€ If you like, you could also tell them youâ€™re looking forward to talking again or wish them a great rest of their day. steps.content: Talk to you tonight â€œTalk to you tomorrowâ€ is the most common meaning for TTYT, but some might use it to say â€œTalk to you tonightâ€ instead. steps.title: Talk to you then

On the other hand, â€œTalk to you tomorrowâ€ is used to make loose plans to talk the following day. Them : â€œLetâ€™s talk this Saturday. Can I call around 6 pm?â€ You : Totally! TTYT! ğŸ˜â€ You can usually tell when someone means â€œTalk to you thenâ€ because theyâ€™ll already have agreed to a date and time before using the acronym.

steps.title: TTYT is a more specific variant of TTYL (â€œTalk to you laterâ€).
steps.content: TTYT is a more specific variant of TTYL (â€œTalk to you laterâ€). TTYL is even more popular than TTYT, although itâ€™s broader and more vague (since â€œlaterâ€ doesnâ€™t necessarily indicate a day or time). You might use TTYL to tell someone youâ€™ll text them again soon without making concrete plans; it could refer to hours, days, weeks, or even longer. [4] X Research source Other related acronyms include: TTYS : Talk to you soon TTYW : Talk to you whenever TTYVS : Talk to you very soon T2UL : Talk to you later
